org.vadere.util.geometry

Class DataTriangle

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.geom.Path2D
      • java.awt.geom.Path2D.Double
        • org.vadere.util.geometry.shapes.VPolygon
          • org.vadere.util.geometry.shapes.VTriangle
            • org.vadere.util.geometry.DataTriangle
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.Shape, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, VShape

    public class DataTriangle
extends VTriangle
    A triangle with additional double data at each point.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • DataTriangle

        public DataTriangle(VPoint p1,
                    VPoint p2,
                    VPoint p3,
                    DataPoint mp)
        Creates a triangle. Points must be given in ccw order.
        Parameters:
        mp - datapoint, holding the data of this triangle

                    DataPoint p3)
        Parameters:
        p1 -
        p2 -
        p3 -

      • DataTriangle

        public DataTriangle(VTriangle triangle)
        Converts the given triangle in a DataTriangle. Note that if the triangle is already a DataTriangle, the data values are NOT copied but also set to 0.0.

      • DataTriangle

        public DataTriangle(VTriangle triangle,
                    double initialData)
        Converts the given triangle in a DataTriangle. Note that if the triangle is already a DataTriangle, the data values are NOT copied but also set to initialData.
        Parameters:
        triangle - the triangle to copy
        initialData - data to set at each vertex

      • DataTriangle

        public DataTriangle(VPoint p1,
                    VPoint p2,
                    VPoint p3)
        A new DataTriangle from VPoint points. The measure point is set to 0,0 with data 0.

    • Method Detail

      • setMeasurePoint

        public void setMeasurePoint(DataPoint newMeasurePoint)
        Sets the measure point.

      • evaluateAtMeasurePoint

        public double evaluateAtMeasurePoint(VPoint toEval)

      • getDataAt

        public double getDataAt(VPoint p)
        Get data at a specified point that must equal one of the triangles vertices.
        Parameters:
        p - p1,p2 or p3 specified in the constructor.
        Returns:
        the data value at that point
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the point does not lie on any of the three vertices.

      • setDataAt

        public void setDataAt(VPoint p,
                      double data)
        Set the data at the given point.
        Parameters:
        p - must be one of the vertices of this triangle. if p is not any of the vertices, nothing happens.
        data - new data at p
